page.title: 02PRIDDY: EASTWATER FARM
page.content: Eastwater Farm is run by Mr and Mrs.Gibbons who breed beef cattle. The farm consists of 200 acres which is mainly grassland but is also cut for silage and hay. Silage making takes place in late summer on this farm which is much later than most farms. This is because of the cooler climate at this altitude. The cattle are black Herefords and are bought when they are ten months old. They are then fattened up until they are two to three years old, then they are ready for market. As well as cattle,there are also sheep and poultry. Older ewes are bought and on average each has one and a half lambs! The lambs are kept until fat enough for market. In the first week of june the sheep are sheared. The fleeces are taken away and turned into jumpers!
